title: Leadership Mindset
description: Your mindset as a leader sets the tone for everything else—your confidence, your decisions, your team's morale. Mastering it is the first step toward becoming a Crystal Clear Leader.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Your mindset as a leader sets the tone for everything else—your confidence, your decisions, your team's morale. Mastering it is the first step toward becoming a Crystal Clear Leader.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You've just received news that your top performer is leaving the company unexpectedly. It's a blow to morale, and you're feeling personally deflated. Your team looks to you for direction—but you're struggling to stay focused and optimistic.

fields.name: mindset_default
fields.label: What would your current mindset default be in this moment?

fields.name: rate_growth_mindset
fields.label: I maintain a growth mindset under pressure (1-10):

fields.name: rate_resilience
fields.label: I model resilience when things go wrong (1-10):

fields.name: rate_internal_dialogue
fields.label: I actively manage my internal dialogue (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: Why did you rate yourself this way? What came up as you thought about each one?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following mindset actions:

fields.name: action_morning_affirmation
fields.label: Start each morning with a 2-minute leadership affirmation

fields.name: action_limiting_belief
fields.label: Identify and write down 1 limiting belief to replace with a growth belief

fields.name: action_mindset_reset
fields.label: Conduct a 15-minute mindset reset with my team or colleague

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Tamika is a new department head who constantly second-guesses her decisions, especially around senior staff. She finds herself apologizing frequently and tends to rework plans even when they were solid.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What belief about herself might be driving Tamika's behavior? How could you coach her to shift it using leadership mindset tools?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Self-Talk Reframing Tool

fields.name: original_thought
fields.label: Original Thought:

fields.name: reframed_statement
fields.label: Reframed Leadership Mindset Statement:

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about improving your leadership mindset, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What mindset shift are you committing to this week?

fields.name: accountability
fields.label: How will you hold yourself accountable?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Goal Setting
description: Setting clear, measurable goals isn't just about checking boxes—it's about aligning your daily actions with your long-term leadership vision. The most effective leaders turn their intentions into reality by mastering the art of goal clarity.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Setting clear, measurable goals isn't just about checking boxes—it's about aligning your daily actions with your long-term leadership vision. The most effective leaders turn their intentions into reality by mastering the art of goal clarity.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You've been asked to lead a new project with a tight deadline, a cross-functional team, and unclear deliverables. The success of this project could elevate your reputation—or hurt it. You know the first step is to set strong goals, but you're not sure where to start.

fields.name: goal_setting_approach
fields.label: How would you begin setting goals for yourself and your team in this situation?

fields.name: rate_measurable_goals
fields.label: I set goals that are measurable and trackable (1-10):

fields.name: rate_goal_alignment
fields.label: I align my personal goals with my team's and company's direction (1-10):

fields.name: rate_follow_through
fields.label: I follow through on my stated goals consistently (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: Why did you give yourself those ratings? What's one goal you set recently that went off course?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_smart_goal
fields.label: Set one SMART goal and break it into 3 actionable steps

fields.name: action_peer_accountability
fields.label: Share one of my goals with a peer for accountability

fields.name: action_realign_goal
fields.label: Review and realign one long-term goal with my current daily actions

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Marcus has big dreams for his department—he wants to double revenue by next year and improve team morale. However, his team is overwhelmed and unclear about their weekly targets. Projects are started and abandoned quickly, and morale is dropping instead of rising.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What's missing in Marcus's goal-setting approach? What would you advise him to do differently using the Crystal Clear Goal Setting Method?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Goal Breakdown Tool

fields.name: main_goal
fields.label: Main Goal:

fields.name: subgoal_1
fields.label: Subgoal 1:

fields.name: subgoal_1_date
fields.label: by date:

fields.name: subgoal_2
fields.label: Subgoal 2:

fields.name: subgoal_2_date
fields.label: by date:

fields.name: subgoal_3
fields.label: Subgoal 3:

fields.name: subgoal_3_date
fields.label: by date:

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about setting or achieving goals more effectively, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What goal are you fully committing to this week?

fields.name: support_needed
fields.label: What support or resources do you need to follow through?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Communication Mastery
description: Effective communication isn't about talking more—it's about connecting deeply, listening actively, and leading clearly. The most successful leaders use communication as a tool to build trust, reduce friction, and drive performance.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Effective communication isn't about talking more—it's about connecting deeply, listening actively, and leading clearly. The most successful leaders use communication as a tool to build trust, reduce friction, and drive performance.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You've just led a team meeting to announce a new strategic initiative. But afterward, several team members seem confused, and two are even resistant. You realize your message may not have landed the way you intended.

fields.name: communication_approach
fields.label: How would you clarify your message and rebuild alignment? What communication mistakes might you have made?

fields.name: rate_clarity_confidence
fields.label: I communicate with clarity and confidence under pressure (1-10):

fields.name: rate_active_listening
fields.label: I listen as actively as I speak (1-10):

fields.name: rate_message_adaptation
fields.label: I adapt my message based on who I'm speaking to (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: What's one recent communication moment you'd like to do over? What would you change?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_feedback
fields.label: Ask 3 team members for honest feedback on my communication clarity

fields.name: action_active_listening
fields.label: Use active listening in at least one difficult conversation

fields.name: action_pause_reflect
fields.label: Pause before responding in conversations to reflect and clarify

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Elena is a passionate project leader who tends to speak in long-winded monologues. Her updates are thorough—but her team often tunes out, missing key points. They've stopped asking questions, and miscommunications are piling up.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What specific strategies could help Elena improve clarity and engagement in her communication?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear "Less is More" Message Filter

fields.name: original_message
fields.label: Original Message:

fields.name: simplified_message
fields.label: Simplified Message:

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about improving communication as a leader, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What's one communication habit you're committing to improve this week?

fields.name: accountability
fields.label: Who will you ask for feedback or accountability?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Time Mastery
description: Time is your most valuable asset as a leader—and the most easily lost. Mastering your time means mastering your priorities, energy, and focus. This Pillar will help you stop reacting and start directing how your time is used.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Time is your most valuable asset as a leader—and the most easily lost. Mastering your time means mastering your priorities, energy, and focus. This Pillar will help you stop reacting and start directing how your time is used.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You're constantly in motion—calls, meetings, emails, follow-ups. Yet, at the end of each day, your most important leadership tasks remain untouched. You know you're busy—but not productive.

fields.name: time_recovery_action
fields.label: What's pulling you off course? What time recovery action could you take today to regain focus?

fields.name: rate_protect_time
fields.label: I protect time for my most important leadership work (1-10):

fields.name: rate_say_no
fields.label: I say no to distractions and low-value requests (1-10):

fields.name: rate_plan_day
fields.label: I plan my day with clarity and structure (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: What is your biggest time-waster during the workday? What keeps showing up and stealing your time?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_identify_distractions
fields.label: Use the 4-Column Exercise to identify distractions and eliminate one time-wasting task

fields.name: action_deep_work
fields.label: Block 90 minutes for uninterrupted deep work each day

fields.name: action_boundaries
fields.label: Communicate clear availability boundaries to my team or clients

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Derek is a team lead who's constantly responding to urgent issues, putting out fires left and right. He's available to everyone, all the time—but his strategic initiatives are months behind.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What mindset and schedule shifts would help Derek reclaim his focus? How could the Jackier Method help him regain control?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear 4-Column Exercise

fields.name: only_i_can_do
fields.label: Only I Can Do This:

fields.name: can_be_delegated
fields.label: Needs to Be Done but Can Be Delegated:

fields.name: can_be_outsourced
fields.label: Routine – Can Be Outsourced Later:

fields.name: should_be_eliminated
fields.label: Should Be Eliminated:

fields.name: delegate_remove
fields.label: What will you delegate or remove this week?

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about reclaiming your time or handling distractions, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What time recovery strategy are you committing to implement this week?

fields.name: distractions_eliminate
fields.label: What distractions will you eliminate or reduce?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Strategic Thinking
description: Tactical leaders solve problems. Strategic leaders prevent them. Strategic thinking is the ability to pause, assess, and plan with clarity—so that you're not just busy, but intentionally moving your team and business forward.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Tactical leaders solve problems. Strategic leaders prevent them. Strategic thinking is the ability to pause, assess, and plan with clarity—so that you're not just busy, but intentionally moving your team and business forward.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You're leading a team that consistently hits short-term goals but seems disconnected from the company's larger mission. They're productive—but not purposeful. You've realized they're working hard, but not strategically.

fields.name: strategic_approach
fields.label: How would you help your team see the bigger picture and align their daily work with the broader vision?

fields.name: rate_long_term
fields.label: I take time each week to reflect and think long-term (1-10):

fields.name: rate_bigger_impact
fields.label: I ask 'what's the bigger impact?' before committing to new work (1-10):

fields.name: rate_align_vision
fields.label: I align short-term actions with long-term vision (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: When was the last time you stepped back to think instead of react? What did you learn?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_strategic_hour
fields.label: Schedule a 'strategic hour' for big-picture thinking

fields.name: action_connect_dots
fields.label: Connect three daily tasks to larger strategic goals

fields.name: action_opportunity_cost
fields.label: Consider opportunity cost before saying 'yes' to new requests

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Michael is a talented director who excels at execution but struggles with anticipating market shifts. His team consistently delivers on current projects but has been blindsided twice by competitor moves that changed their industry.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What strategic thinking practices would help Michael become more forward-looking? How could he balance execution with anticipation?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Strategic Filter

fields.name: current_priority
fields.label: Current Priority/Project:

fields.name: strategic_alignment
fields.label: How does this align with our long-term vision?

fields.name: opportunity_cost
fields.label: What am I NOT doing because of this priority?

fields.name: six_month_impact
fields.label: Six-month impact if successful:

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about improving your strategic thinking, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What strategic thinking practice are you committing to this week?

fields.name: accountability
fields.label: How will you make space for this practice in your schedule?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Emotional Intelligence
description: Emotional Intelligence (EQ) is the ability to recognize and regulate your emotions—and to understand and influence the emotions of others. Great leaders don't just lead with intellect. They lead with insight, empathy, and control.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Emotional Intelligence (EQ) is the ability to recognize and regulate your emotions—and to understand and influence the emotions of others. Great leaders don't just lead with intellect. They lead with insight, empathy, and control.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You're in a team meeting when a colleague unexpectedly challenges your decision in front of others. You feel defensive, even a bit angry. Everyone is watching to see how you'll respond.

fields.name: emotional_response
fields.label: What's your internal response? How would an emotionally intelligent leader handle this situation?

fields.name: rate_calm_focused
fields.label: I stay calm and focused in emotionally charged situations (1-10):

fields.name: rate_body_language
fields.label: I am aware of how my tone and body language affect others (1-10):

fields.name: rate_emotional_triggers
fields.label: I recognize emotional triggers and manage them effectively (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: When was the last time your emotions took over in a leadership moment? What was the result?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_identify_trigger
fields.label: Identify one emotional trigger and track it for 3 days

fields.name: action_pause_response
fields.label: Practice 'pause before response' in all feedback conversations

fields.name: action_ask_colleague
fields.label: Ask a trusted colleague how they experience my emotional leadership

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Jared is a passionate, high-performing manager—but his emotions often get the best of him. He interrupts people, reacts defensively to feedback, and shows visible frustration when things go off track. His team respects his skills but fears his moods.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: How could Jared improve his emotional intelligence without losing his passion or energy?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Emotional Awareness Tool

fields.name: trigger_situation
fields.label: Trigger Situation:

fields.name: physical_response
fields.label: Physical Response:

fields.name: thought_pattern
fields.label: Thought Pattern:

fields.name: regulation_strategy
fields.label: Regulation Strategy:

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about improving your emotional intelligence as a leader, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What emotional intelligence skill are you committing to develop this week?

fields.name: accountability
fields.label: How will you track your progress?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Delegation and Team Empowerment
description: Delegation isn't giving tasks away—it's giving others a chance to rise. Empowered leaders build empowered teams by assigning responsibility, setting expectations, and allowing others to succeed (and sometimes fail) without micromanagement.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Delegation isn't giving tasks away—it's giving others a chance to rise. Empowered leaders build empowered teams by assigning responsibility, setting expectations, and allowing others to succeed (and sometimes fail) without micromanagement.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You're managing a large project and realize you're the bottleneck—every major task flows through you. You feel pressure to maintain control but you're falling behind, and your team feels underutilized.

fields.name: delegation_blockers
fields.label: What's stopping you from delegating more effectively? Who on your team could grow if given the chance?

fields.name: rate_trust_team
fields.label: I trust my team to complete important tasks without me (1-10):

fields.name: rate_delegate_responsibilities
fields.label: I delegate responsibilities—not just tasks (1-10):

fields.name: rate_coach_support
fields.label: I coach and support instead of micromanaging (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: What's one task you're holding onto that someone else could own—and why haven't you let it go yet?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_identify_task
fields.label: Identify one task I currently do that I will delegate by end of week

fields.name: action_ask_team_member
fields.label: Ask a team member what responsibility they'd like to grow into

fields.name: action_provide_expectations
fields.label: Provide clear expectations and check-in milestones for a delegated assignment

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Lena is known for high standards and flawless work. But her team is disengaged—she redoes their work, takes on too much, and doesn't trust others to execute. Her department is stuck, and Lena is exhausted.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What mindset shift would help Lena delegate effectively? What systems could help her empower her team without sacrificing quality?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Delegation Planner

fields.name: recurring_task
fields.label: Choose one recurring task you handle each week:

fields.name: task_essential
fields.label: Is this task essential to me or could someone else own it?

fields.name: training_needed
fields.label: What training or context would they need?

fields.name: follow_up
fields.label: How will I follow up without micromanaging?

fields.name: delegation_plan
fields.label: Create a short delegation plan with a timeline and check-in point:

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about improving delegation or empowering your team, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What's one delegation step you're committing to take this week?

fields.name: measure_success
fields.label: How will you measure whether the task was delegated successfully?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Leading Through Change and Uncertainty
description: Uncertainty reveals leadership. Great leaders don't always have the answers—but they do provide stability, direction, and reassurance. Mastering this Pillar means learning to lead with clarity even when the path ahead is unclear.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Uncertainty reveals leadership. Great leaders don't always have the answers—but they do provide stability, direction, and reassurance. Mastering this Pillar means learning to lead with clarity even when the path ahead is unclear.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: Your company just announced a major organizational shift. Morale is shaken. People are whispering, productivity is dropping, and everyone's waiting for your reaction.

fields.name: first_move
fields.label: What's your first move? How do you lead your team through uncertainty—even if you don't have all the answers?

fields.name: rate_steady_calm
fields.label: I remain steady and calm when things around me are changing (1-10):

fields.name: rate_communicate_clearly
fields.label: I communicate clearly even when outcomes are unknown (1-10):

fields.name: rate_optimism_transparency
fields.label: I lead with optimism and transparency in uncertain times (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: Think back to the last time you experienced major change. What did you do well as a leader—and what would you do differently now?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_host_checkin
fields.label: Host a 10-minute check-in to address my team's biggest questions

fields.name: action_acknowledge_unknown
fields.label: Acknowledge what I *don't* know—and share what I *do* know

fields.name: action_model_calm
fields.label: Choose one new challenge to model calm, clarity, and flexibility

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Raj avoids conflict and change like the plague. When a crisis hits, he either shuts down or disappears into work, avoiding tough conversations. His team feels abandoned and anxious whenever something shifts.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What new behaviors would help Raj grow into a leader who thrives during change?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Change Clarity Framework

fields.name: current_change
fields.label: Identify a current or upcoming change affecting your role or team:

fields.name: know_for_sure
fields.label: What do I know for sure?

fields.name: dont_know_yet
fields.label: What don't I know (yet)?

fields.name: team_needs
fields.label: What does my team need to hear from me right now?

fields.name: lead_with_stability
fields.label: How can I lead with stability this week?

fields.name: team_message
fields.label: Craft a short, calming message you can share with your team:

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about leading confidently through uncertainty, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What's one step you'll take this week to lead with confidence during change?

fields.name: team_remember
fields.label: What do you want your team to remember about how you showed up?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Conflict Resolution and Difficult Conversations
description: Conflict avoided is leadership postponed. Great leaders don't fear difficult conversations—they master them. This Pillar gives you the tools to address friction, create clarity, and lead through tension instead of around it.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Conflict avoided is leadership postponed. Great leaders don't fear difficult conversations—they master them. This Pillar gives you the tools to address friction, create clarity, and lead through tension instead of around it.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: Two key team members aren't speaking after a disagreement. One has come to you for support; the other is disengaged and distant. You know you need to step in—but you're not sure how to start.

fields.name: conflict_handling
fields.label: How would you handle this conflict as a leader? What's your first step in restoring trust and resolving the tension?

fields.name: rate_address_conflict
fields.label: I address conflict directly and respectfully (1-10):

fields.name: rate_create_space
fields.label: I create space for others to express disagreement (1-10):

fields.name: rate_stay_calm
fields.label: I stay calm and focused during tense conversations (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: What's one conversation you've avoided—and what's the cost of continuing to avoid it?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_schedule_conversation
fields.label: Schedule one conversation I've been putting off

fields.name: action_neutral_language
fields.label: Use neutral language to describe behavior, not character

fields.name: action_active_listening
fields.label: Practice active listening and summarize what I hear before responding

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Carlos is respected and kind—but he avoids hard conversations. When team members underperform or create tension, he says nothing. As a result, standards slide, resentment builds, and his credibility suffers.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What scripts or tools could help Carlos step into conflict instead of sidestepping it?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Difficult Conversation Prep Sheet

fields.name: unresolved_conflict
fields.label: Identify one unresolved conflict or tense relationship:

fields.name: issue
fields.label: What is the issue?

fields.name: desired_outcome
fields.label: What outcome do I want from the conversation?

fields.name: other_person_needs
fields.label: What does the other person need to hear from me?

fields.name: i_need_to_hear
fields.label: What do I need to hear from them?

fields.name: opening_sentences
fields.label: Plan the opening 2–3 sentences you'll use to begin the conversation:

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about handling conflict or tough conversations, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What difficult conversation are you committing to have this week?

fields.name: build_trust
fields.label: How will you ensure the conversation builds—not breaks—trust?

fields.name: revisit_date
fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Creating a High-Performance Environment
description: High-performing teams don't happen by chance—they're built with intention. Leaders shape the environment. They set clear expectations, celebrate effort and excellence, and model what success looks like.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: High-performing teams don't happen by chance—they're built with intention. Leaders shape the environment. They set clear expectations, celebrate effort and excellence, and model what success looks like.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: Your team is talented—but their performance is inconsistent. Some are exceeding expectations, while others are coasting. You know it's time to raise the bar without creating burnout or fear.

fields.name: reset_standards
fields.label: How do you reset standards, energize your team, and create a culture of excellence?

fields.name: rate_model_standards
fields.label: I consistently model high standards and focus (1-10):

fields.name: rate_accountability
fields.label: I hold others accountable in a constructive, clear way (1-10):

fields.name: rate_feedback
fields.label: I provide regular feedback that promotes growth (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: What's one standard you've let slide? How is that affecting team performance?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_define_excellence
fields.label: Define and share my expectations for 'excellence' with my team

fields.name: action_recognize_team_member
fields.label: Recognize one team member for going above and beyond

fields.name: action_revisit_underperforming
fields.label: Revisit one underperforming area and communicate a performance reset

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Brittany is friendly and well-liked by her team—but avoids confrontation and rarely enforces performance standards. Her team enjoys working for her, but their results are mediocre. She wants to be liked more than respected.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: How can Brittany raise standards and still maintain positive team relationships?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Team Environment Check

fields.name: top_behaviors
fields.label: List the top 3 behaviors you expect from a high-performing team:

fields.name: behavior_assessment

title: Decision-Making with Clarity and Confidence
description: Leadership is decision-making. Every choice you make shapes your influence, your results, and your team's trust in you. When you make decisions rooted in clarity, confidence, and consistency, you create momentum and credibility—even in uncertainty.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: Leadership is decision-making. Every choice you make shapes your influence, your results, and your team's trust in you. When you make decisions rooted in clarity, confidence, and consistency, you create momentum and credibility—even in uncertainty.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You're facing a big decision: two strong paths, each with pros and cons. One feels safer, the other bolder. You're getting mixed feedback, and your team is waiting for clarity.

fields.name: decision_approach
fields.label: How do you move forward without second-guessing yourself? What decision-making tools or principles will guide you?

fields.name: rate_timely_decisions
fields.label: I make timely decisions without overthinking (1-10):

fields.name: rate_data_intuition
fields.label: I base decisions on data and intuition (1-10):

fields.name: rate_explain_decisions
fields.label: I explain my decisions with clarity and confidence (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: What's one recent decision you've struggled with—and what made it difficult?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_identify_decision
fields.label: Identify one decision I've delayed—and make it within 24 hours

fields.name: action_use_tool
fields.label: Use a structured tool to evaluate a current choice

fields.name: action_communicate_decision
fields.label: Communicate one decision with clarity to my team

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Alvin is thoughtful, smart, and careful—but he's known for dragging out decisions. He constantly asks for more input, changes his mind, and misses windows of opportunity. His team is losing confidence in his leadership.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What structure or mindset shift would help Alvin make faster, clearer decisions without sacrificing quality?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear 4-Question Decision Framework

fields.name: real_options
fields.label: What are my two (or more) real options?

fields.name: long_term_impact
fields.label: What is the best long-term impact of each?

fields.name: fear_assessment
fields.label: What am I afraid of—and is that fear justified?

fields.name: leadership_look
fields.label: What does leadership look like in this situation?

fields.name: ask_eric_info
fields.label: If you could ask Eric GPT one question about decision-making as a leader, what would it be?

fields.name: ask_eric
fields.label: Write your question here:

fields.name: commitment
fields.label: What decision will you make and communicate this week?

fields.name: build_clarity
fields.label: How will you ensure that decision builds clarity and momentum?

fields.label: Date to revisit this worksheet:

title: Execution: Turning Plans Into Results
description: A brilliant plan means nothing without follow-through. Leaders who execute consistently turn goals into outcomes, vision into momentum, and effort into measurable success. This Pillar is about doing the work that matters—on time and with purpose.

fields.name: intro
fields.label: A brilliant plan means nothing without follow-through. Leaders who execute consistently turn goals into outcomes, vision into momentum, and effort into measurable success. This Pillar is about doing the work that matters—on time and with purpose.

fields.name: scenario_challenge
fields.label: Leadership Scenario Challenge: You've created a detailed strategy and your team is fired up. But two weeks in, progress has stalled. Deadlines are slipping. Everyone agrees the plan is great—but no one seems to be executing it consistently.

fields.name: missing_link
fields.label: What's the missing link? How do you reestablish execution and drive your plan across the finish line?

fields.name: rate_follow_through
fields.label: I follow through consistently on the most important tasks (1-10):

fields.name: rate_track_progress
fields.label: I track progress and hold myself/team accountable to deadlines (1-10):

fields.name: rate_break_goals
fields.label: I break big goals into manageable, time-bound action steps (1-10):

fields.name: reflection
fields.label: What is one plan or project you've started but not finished—and why did execution break down?

fields.name: action_steps_info
fields.label: This week, I will commit to the following:

fields.name: action_schedule_steps
fields.label: Choose one priority and schedule the next three action steps on my calendar

fields.name: action_clarify_roles
fields.label: Clarify team roles and deadlines for one stalled project

fields.name: action_use_tracker
fields.label: Use a visual tracker or checklist to monitor execution this week

fields.name: action_optional
fields.label: Optional action step

fields.name: case_study
fields.label: Mini Case Study: Tasha is full of ideas—she sets big goals and inspires others easily. But execution often breaks down after kickoff. She's easily distracted, struggles to follow through, and finds herself apologizing for missed milestones.

fields.name: case_study_response
fields.label: What structure, tools, or accountability would help Tasha become an execution-driven leader?

fields.name: challenge_info
fields.label: 15-Minute Challenge: Crystal Clear Execution Snapshot
